description.last_approved_text:
Marquis

[[col:green]] [[b]]%+n%[[/b]] recruitment and upkeep cost for captains[[/col]] (own armies)

[[col:orange]]With his lineage and flamboyant presence, Yuan Shao is a role model for the common solider and his officers.[[/col]]

effects.description:
Marquis

[[col:green]] [[b]]%+n%[[/b]] recruitment and upkeep cost for captains[[/col]] (own armies)

[[col:orange]]With his lineage and flamboyant presence, Yuan Shao is a role model for the common solider and his officers.[[/col]]

description.last_approved_text:
[[col:orange]]Credibility[[/col]]

A wise, charismatic leader and skilled diplomat.

[[col:green]]Passive influence resource gain[[/col]]
A [[b]]proxy war[[/b]] is a war you trigger between two other independent parties, without your direct involvement as one of the war's [[b]]participants[[/b]].

effects.description: A [[b]]proxy war[[/b]] is a war you trigger between two other independent parties, without your direct involvement as one of the war's [[b]]participants[[/b]].

description.last_approved_text: Relations between two factions are determined by their [[b]]diplomatic attitude[[/b]] to one another. Good [[b]]relations[[/b]] will mean a higher chance for constructive deals and that war is less likely.

effects.description: Relations between two factions are determined by their [[b]]diplomatic attitude[[/b]] to one another. Good [[b]]relations[[/b]] will mean a higher chance for constructive deals and that war is less likely.

description.last_approved_text: This resource automatically increases each turn.

effects.description: This resource automatically increases each turn.

description.last_approved_text: [[b]]Public order[[/b]] is a measure of your control over a settlement. If it falls to -100, a [[b]]rebellion[[/b]] will trigger.\n\n[[b]]Corruption[[/b]] represents the loss of government effiency as a realm grows in size. It reduces [[b]]tax income[[/b]] in your commanderies faction-wide.

effects.description: [[b]]Public order[[/b]] is a measure of your control over a settlement. If it falls to -100, a [[b]]rebellion[[/b]] will trigger.\n\n[[b]]Corruption[[/b]] represents the loss of government effiency as a realm grows in size. It reduces [[b]]tax income[[/b]] in your commanderies faction-wide.

description.last_approved_text: [[b]]Coercion[[/b]] is used to pressure other factions into disfavourable deals during [[b]]diplomatic negotiations[[/b]].

effects.description: [[b]]Coercion[[/b]] is used to pressure other factions into disfavourable deals during [[b]]diplomatic negotiations[[/b]].

description.last_approved_text: [[b]]Razing[[/b]] a settlement utterly [[b]]destroys[[/b]] it, making it uninhabitable for any faction unless they spend time and [[b]]funds[[/b]] to rebuild the settlement.

effects.description: [[b]]Razing[[/b]] a settlement utterly [[b]]destroys[[/b]] it, making it uninhabitable for any faction unless they spend time and [[b]]funds[[/b]] to rebuild the settlement.

description.last_approved_text: Every character has a [[b]]title rank[[/b]] that impacts his [[b]]satisfaction[[/b]] and his [[b]]salary[[/b]]. It can be increased by [[b]]promotions[[/b]], and also decreased by [[b]]demotions[[/b]].

effects.description: Every character has a [[b]]title rank[[/b]] that impacts his [[b]]satisfaction[[/b]] and his [[b]]salary[[/b]]. It can be increased by [[b]]promotions[[/b]], and also decreased by [[b]]demotions[[/b]].

description.last_approved_text: This resource automatically decreases each turn.

effects.description: This resource automatically decreases each turn.

description.last_approved_text: The [[b]]court[[/b]] consists of characters in special government posts that have important effects on your faction.

effects.description: The [[b]]court[[/b]] consists of characters in special government posts that have important effects on your faction.

description.last_approved_text: [[b]]Administrator[[/b]] is a position within your government. An administrator oversees the local government in a commandery and provides certain bonuses to these lands.

effects.description: [[b]]Administrator[[/b]] is a position within your government. An administrator oversees the local government in a commandery and provides certain bonuses to these lands.

description.last_approved_text: The unique diplomatic deal [[b]]trade monopoly[[/b]] increases the [[b]]trade influence[[/b]] and therefore increases income of all trade agreements.

effects.description: The unique diplomatic deal [[b]]trade monopoly[[/b]] increases the [[b]]trade influence[[/b]] and therefore increases income of all trade agreements.

description.last_approved_text: Income from [[b]]trade agreements[[/b]] is determined by the [[b]]trade influence[[/b]] of the participating factions. Higher trade influence means more income.

effects.description: Income from [[b]]trade agreements[[/b]] is determined by the [[b]]trade influence[[/b]] of the participating factions. Higher trade influence means more income.

description.last_approved_text: [[b]]Prestige[[/b]] is required to achieve higher faction ranks, which unlock new features and bonuses to your faction.

effects.description: [[b]]Prestige[[/b]] is required to achieve higher faction ranks, which unlock new features and bonuses to your faction.

description.last_approved_text: [[b]]Administrator[[/b]] is a position within your government. An administrator oversees the local government in a commandery and provides certain bonuses to these lands.

effects.description: [[b]]Administrator[[/b]] is a position within your government. An administrator oversees the local government in a commandery and provides certain bonuses to these lands.

description.last_approved_text: [[b]]Satisfaction[[/b]] is a measure of a character's happiness and loyalty in your faction. It is important to keep satisfaction in check to prevent defections.

effects.description: [[b]]Satisfaction[[/b]] is a measure of a character's happiness and loyalty in your faction. It is important to keep satisfaction in check to prevent defections.

description.last_approved_text: Characters can be sent on [[b]]assignments[[/b]] to carry your orders into your commanderies. They typically provide bonuses to the local government and local characters.

effects.description: Characters can be sent on [[b]]assignments[[/b]] to carry your orders into your commanderies. They typically provide bonuses to the local government and local characters.

description.last_approved_text: The [[b]]court[[/b]] consists of characters in special government posts that have important effects on your faction.\n\nCharacters increase their [[b]]rank[[/b]] by accumulating [[b]]experience[[/b]] through military and civic activities.

effects.description: The [[b]]court[[/b]] consists of characters in special government posts that have important effects on your faction.\n\nCharacters increase their [[b]]rank[[/b]] by accumulating [[b]]experience[[/b]] through military and civic activities.

description.last_approved_text: [[b]]Encamp[[/b]] is a stance for armies that allow them to set up a more permanent camp.\n\n[[b]]Food[[/b]] is used to establish bigger settlements.

effects.description: [[b]]Encamp[[/b]] is a stance for armies that allow them to set up a more permanent camp.\n\n[[b]]Food[[/b]] is used to establish bigger settlements.

description.last_approved_text: [[b]]Military supplies[[/b]] allow an army to stay in fighting condition and will have an impact on [[b]]replenishment[[/b]] and [[b]]morale[[/b]].

effects.description: [[b]]Military supplies[[/b]] allow an army to stay in fighting condition and will have an impact on [[b]]replenishment[[/b]] and [[b]]morale[[/b]].

description.last_approved_text: Recruitment and maintenance of units requires [[b]]funds[[/b]] from your [[b]]treasury[[/b]].

effects.description: Recruitment and maintenance of units requires [[b]]funds[[/b]] from your [[b]]treasury[[/b]].

description.last_approved_text: [[b]]Satisfaction[[/b]] is a measure of a character's happiness and [[b]]loyalty[[/b]] in your faction. It is important to keep satisfaction in check to prevent [[b]]defections[[/b]] and to prevent characters from [[b]]leaving[[/b]].

effects.description: [[b]]Satisfaction[[/b]] is a measure of a character's happiness and [[b]]loyalty[[/b]] in your faction. It is important to keep satisfaction in check to prevent [[b]]defections[[/b]] and to prevent characters from [[b]]leaving[[/b]].

description.last_approved_text: This resource automatically decreases each turn.

effects.description: This resource automatically decreases each turn.

description.last_approved_text: Prestigious lineage allows you to [[b]]forge alliances[[/b]] from the very beginning of the campaign. Most factions will not be able to form these diplomatic pacts this early, but all factions are able to join from the beginning.

effects.description: Prestigious lineage allows you to [[b]]forge alliances[[/b]] from the very beginning of the campaign. Most factions will not be able to form these diplomatic pacts this early, but all factions are able to join from the beginning.

description.last_approved_text: [[b]]Characters[[/b]] will periodically appear in your court, offering their services in myriad positions around your realm.

effects.description: [[b]]Characters[[/b]] will periodically appear in your court, offering their services in myriad positions around your realm.

description.last_approved_text: After a victorious [[b]]siege[[/b]], various [[b]]occupation options[[/b]] are available. Yuan Shao has access to a [[b]]unique option[[/b]] that provides better [[b]]military supply[[/b]] and increased [[b]]faction support[[/b]] after occupation.

effects.description: After a victorious [[b]]siege[[/b]], various [[b]]occupation options[[/b]] are available. Yuan Shao has access to a [[b]]unique option[[/b]] that provides better [[b]]military supply[[/b]] and increased [[b]]faction support[[/b]] after occupation.

description.last_approved_text: [[b]]Alliances[[/b]] and [[b]]coalitions[[/b]] are permanent diplomatic relationships between factions that are willing to join each others' wars and to defend each other.

effects.description: [[b]]Alliances[[/b]] and [[b]]coalitions[[/b]] are permanent diplomatic relationships between factions that are willing to join each others' wars and to defend each other.

description.last_approved_text: Legitimacy allows you to [[b]]forge alliances[[/b]] from the very beginning of the campaign. Most factions will not be able to form these diplomatic pacts this early, but all factions are able to join from the beginning.

effects.description: Legitimacy allows you to [[b]]forge alliances[[/b]] from the very beginning of the campaign. Most factions will not be able to form these diplomatic pacts this early, but all factions are able to join from the beginning.

description.last_approved_text: [[b]]Prestige[[/b]] is required to achieve higher faction ranks, which unlock new features and bonuses to your faction.

effects.description: [[b]]Prestige[[/b]] is required to achieve higher faction ranks, which unlock new features and bonuses to your faction.

description.last_approved_text: [[b]]Characters[[/b]] will periodically appear in your court, offering their services in myriad positions around your realm.

effects.description: [[b]]Characters[[/b]] will periodically appear in your court, offering their services in myriad positions around your realm.

description.last_approved_text: [[b]]Legitimacy[[/b]] can be increased by demanding [[b]]support for legitimacy[[/b]] in diplomacy.\n\nAdditionally, all [[b]]vassals[[/b]] will provide legitimacy automatically.

effects.description: [[b]]Legitimacy[[/b]] can be increased by demanding [[b]]support for legitimacy[[/b]] in diplomacy.\n\nAdditionally, all [[b]]vassals[[/b]] will provide legitimacy automatically.

description.last_approved_text: [[b]]Yellow Turban[[/b]] factions are seen as outlaws and diplomacy with them is normally [[b]]restricted[[/b]]. Zhang Yan can [[b]]improve relations[[/b]] with Yellow Turbans and can align himself with them.

effects.description: [[b]]Yellow Turban[[/b]] factions are seen as outlaws and diplomacy with them is normally [[b]]restricted[[/b]]. Zhang Yan can [[b]]improve relations[[/b]] with Yellow Turbans and can align himself with them.

description.last_approved_text: In an [[b]]ambush[[/b]], the defending force is attacked from both sides while marching in column, leaving the attacker to choose the best time to strike.

effects.description: In an [[b]]ambush[[/b]], the defending force is attacked from both sides while marching in column, leaving the attacker to choose the best time to strike.

description.last_approved_text: [[b]]Satisfaction[[/b]] is a measure of a character's happiness and [[b]]loyalty[[/b]] in your faction. It is important to keep satisfaction in check to prevent [[b]]defections[[/b]] and to prevent characters from [[b]]leaving[[/b]].\n\n[[b]]Morale[[/b]] determines how long units can stay in combat before running away.

It is important to keep satisfaction in check to prevent [[b]]defections[[/b]] and to prevent characters from [[b]]leaving[[/b]].\n\n[[b]]Morale[[/b]] determines how long units can stay in combat before running away.

description.last_approved_text: Accumulate enlightenment by researching reforms, constructing special buildings, increasing character skills and granting character positions. Once sufficient enlightenment is attained, the next faction rank is unlocked. A higher faction rank provides better bonuses and gives access to new reforms.

description.last_approved_text: [[b]]Population[[/b]] are the citizens in your settlements and commanderies. They are a primary driver for your [[b]]economy[[/b]] and [[b]]replenishment[[/b]] of military armies.
